questions.question: For processes with burst times of 5, 15, and 25 units, and arrival times of 1, 4, and 8 respectively, how many context switches occur if the system uses a Round-Robin scheduling algorithm with a time quantum of 10 units? (Do not count the context switches at time zero and at the end.)
To prevent a deadlock, a system must ensure that resources are allocated in such a way that:

options.A: No resource is held by any process while waiting for another resource.
options.B: Each process holds at least one resource while requesting additional resources.
options.C: All resources are allocated to a single process at a time.
options.D: A circular wait condition cannot occur.
